1587 118th Congress October 02, 2024 [S. 2228] AN ACT To amend the William M. (Mac) Thornberry National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021 to clarify the scope of a major Federal action under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 with respect to certain projects relating to the production of semiconductors, and for other purposes. citations.text: paragraphs (4) and (13) of section 50.19(b) of title 24
citations.context: (referred to in this subsection as <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">NEPA) or an undertaking for the purposes of division A of subtitle III of title 54, United States Code, if— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="id2b92441420a644c2859d56568010cb31" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the activity described in the application for that project has commenced not later than December 31, 2024; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="id50029131fbfd4521be4c022554dc86aa" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the Federal financial assistance provided is in the form of a loan or loan guarantee; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="idc620e17f1ce44f7abd9d09cab79b3514" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) the Federal financial assistance provided, excluding any loan or loan guarantee, comprises not more than 10 percent of the total estimated cost of the project. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="idf9e2e45d8fa941809908a8108b4ad926" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Savings clause Nothing in this subsection may be construed as altering whether an activity described in subparagraph (A), (B), or (C) of paragraph (1) is considered to be a major Federal action under NEPA, or an undertaking under division A of subtitle III of title 54, United States Code, for a reason other than that the activity is eligible for Federal financial assistance provided under this section. ; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="id36f567e2c99c459087b663cc558a132f" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) in section 9909 (15 U.S.C.

; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="id36f567e2c99c459087b663cc558a132f" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) in section 9909 (15 U.S.C. 4659), by adding at the end the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="id67456e4c6b684147be6ec4addff3390c" style="OLC"> <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="d1e114" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="idf38172a1a26d480494cb1c6dfc6f3a8e" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Lead Federal agency and cooperating agencies <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="id398cd765ab9844af82b8393c283b6761" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Definition In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">lead agency has the meaning given the term in section 111 of NEPA (42 U.S.C. 4336e).

; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="id36f567e2c99c459087b663cc558a132f" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) in section 9909 (15 U.S.C. 4659), by adding at the end the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="id67456e4c6b684147be6ec4addff3390c" style="OLC"> <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="d1e114" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="idf38172a1a26d480494cb1c6dfc6f3a8e" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Lead Federal agency and cooperating agencies <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="id398cd765ab9844af82b8393c283b6761" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Definition In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">lead agency has the meaning given the term in section 111 of NEPA (42 U.S.C. 4336e).

4336e). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="idac1ecb2ba5984808bc4fc01a4fa23c92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Option to serve as lead agency With respect to a covered activity that is a major Federal action under NEPA, and with respect to which the Department of Commerce is authorized or required by law to issue an authorization or take action for or relating to that covered activity, the Department of Commerce shall have the first right to serve as the lead agency with respect to that covered activity under NEPA. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="id2c1b75cde5944f619ee09a8373c05c36" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Categorical exclusions <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="id90339d6cf27547d6a92e55512df68fe4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Establishment of categorical exclusions Each of the following categorical exclusions is established for the National Institute of Standards and Technology with respect to a covered activity and, beginning on the date of enactment of this subsection, is available for use by the Secretary with respect to a covered activity: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="id7ab0a56dc3114f558e1dac7e43d2b1ef" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Categorical exclusion 17.04.d (relating to the acquisition of machinery and equipment) in the document entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">EDA Program to Implement the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 and Other Federal Environmental Mandates As Required (Directive No.

4336e). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="idac1ecb2ba5984808bc4fc01a4fa23c92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Option to serve as lead agency With respect to a covered activity that is a major Federal action under NEPA, and with respect to which the Department of Commerce is authorized or required by law to issue an authorization or take action for or relating to that covered activity, the Department of Commerce shall have the first right to serve as the lead agency with respect to that covered activity under NEPA. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="id2c1b75cde5944f619ee09a8373c05c36" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Categorical exclusions <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="id90339d6cf27547d6a92e55512df68fe4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Establishment of categorical exclusions Each of the following categorical exclusions is established for the National Institute of Standards and Technology with respect to a covered activity and, beginning on the date of enactment of this subsection, is available for use by the Secretary with respect to a covered activity: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="id7ab0a56dc3114f558e1dac7e43d2b1ef" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Categorical exclusion 17.04.d (relating to the acquisition of machinery and equipment) in the document entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">EDA Program to Implement the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 and Other Federal Environmental Mandates As Required (Directive No.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="idac1ecb2ba5984808bc4fc01a4fa23c92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Option to serve as lead agency With respect to a covered activity that is a major Federal action under NEPA, and with respect to which the Department of Commerce is authorized or required by law to issue an authorization or take action for or relating to that covered activity, the Department of Commerce shall have the first right to serve as the lead agency with respect to that covered activity under NEPA. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="id2c1b75cde5944f619ee09a8373c05c36" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Categorical exclusions <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="id90339d6cf27547d6a92e55512df68fe4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Establishment of categorical exclusions Each of the following categorical exclusions is established for the National Institute of Standards and Technology with respect to a covered activity and, beginning on the date of enactment of this subsection, is available for use by the Secretary with respect to a covered activity: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="id7ab0a56dc3114f558e1dac7e43d2b1ef" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Categorical exclusion 17.04.d (relating to the acquisition of machinery and equipment) in the document entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">EDA Program to Implement the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 and Other Federal Environmental Mandates As Required (Directive No. 17.02–2; effective date October 14, 1992).

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="iddbc9cb25099c4f0ca8ce1392afdf8ab0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Categorical exclusions B1.24, B1.31, B2.5, and B5.1 in Appendix B to subpart D of part 1021 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations, or any successor regulation. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="id63bc1b5a0478430f8656227e0ceed603" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) The categorical exclusions described in paragraphs (4) and (13) of section 50.19(b) of title 24, Code of Federal Regulations, or any successor regulation. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="idfb3e74707ba34d28a713a4e6538f7455" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) Categorical exclusion (c)(1) in Appendix B to part 651 of title 32, Code of Federal Regulations, or any successor regulation.
